climbs.name: F*ck Me Pumps
climbs.fa: FA: Alex Kirkpatrick (2014).  Equipped By: Dan Michael & Ray Ringle

content.description: A fun and challenging climb if one can overlook the development tactics of the era. The climb trends left on overhanging terrain with mostly decent holds that are a fairly far apart. There are several undercling sequences that are very tough. This route does not get much traffic.Pretty easy to throw a rope down from the top and hang draws if one is so inclined.
content.location: On Cowpunks wall this is the 2nd route from the left arete where the route Cowpunks is located.

content.description: This route follows bolts on the left face/ arete of the wall. The climbing is fairly straight forward until a crux about 2/3 of the way up where you are forced directly onto the arete. After deciphering the tricky sequence many sharp holds await you as the climb turns to vertical/ slabby. This climb has very enjoyable movement up to the point where things get sharp and slightly awkward following the crux.

This rock will get sun most of the day and you are unlikely to see many other climbers here as there are few routes and they are all harder.  The rock is overhung and fairly featureless aside from the "confortized/ man made" holds on two of the climbs.
